articles.title: British homes were built to retain heat. That’s becoming a problem.
articles.description: New regulations, called Part O, took effect in England in June, requiring that new homes are built with some measures to combat overheating.
articles.content:
For generations, homes in Britain were designed to retain heat, to make cold winters bearable.
